summary: This is a victim notification letter from the U.S. Department of Justice Victim Notification System to an individual identified as a victim or potential victim in the Ghislaine Maxwell case. It informs the recipient of their rights under the Victims' Rights and Restitution Act and the Crime Victims' Rights Act, provides contact information for prosecutors and victim services, and explains how to receive ongoing case updates.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Arrested and charged as a result of a criminal investigation into potential co-conspirators of Jeffrey Epstein; the main charge is categorized as Project Safe Childhood.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The investigation into Ghislaine Maxwell arises from an investigation into his potential co-conspirators; the recipient was previously identified as a victim or potential victim in a related case involving him.

connections.description: The letter states the charges against Maxwell arise from an investigation into potential co-conspirators of Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Arrest and charging of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested and charged as a result of a criminal investigation conducted by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

keyFacts: The recipient is identified by law enforcement as a victim or potential victim in a matter related to the Ghislaine Maxwell criminal case.
The charges against Ghislaine Maxwell arise from an investigation into potential co-conspirators of Jeffrey Epstein and are categorized under Project Safe Childhood.

The letter outlines the rights of crime victims under the Victims' Rights and Restitution Act and the Crime Victims' Rights Act, including the right to notification, protection, and to be heard in proceedings.
The recipient is offered the option to receive ongoing notifications about the Maxwell case through the Victim Notification System (VNS).
